Name: chloridazon production | chloridazon | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Chloridazon is produced in four steps from acetylene:;C2H2 + 2 CH2O → C4H6O2;C4H6O2 + 4 Cl2 + H2O → C4H2Cl2O3 + 6 HCl;C4H2Cl2O3 + C6H8N2 → C10H6Cl2N2O + 2 H2O;C10H6Cl2N2O + NH3 → C10H8ClN3O + HCl;C6H8N2 (phenyl hydrazine) is produced from aniline and sodium nitrite.;Sodium hydroxide is added to neutralize the formed hydrochloric acid.;Reference(s):;Unger T., (1996). Pesticide Synthesis Handbook, Noyes Publication.;Appleby A.P., Muller F., Carpy, S., (2011): Weed Control, in Ullmanns Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Weinheim, Wiley-VCH.
